text: Spellbooks are the primary mode of casting for most Scriptomages (and Nomenomists).
Spellbooks have a few things going for them, namely their efficiency and convenience.
When a human casts a spell using a Spellbook, by default the spell will have only
have 70% the cooldown of a spell cast verbally.
Additionally, you have the obvious convenience of not having to speak the whole
That being said, Spellbooks come with one major drawback:
Each Spellbook costs resources to craft, and requires you to write and finalize a book.
Since this takes more time and resources, and is less flexible, some mages prefer to
only write down their favorites, and craft spells on the fly to match other situations.
